column2: DEEP SPOT - BASELINE LAKES SPRING PROTOCOL
Additional helpers: Matt DellaMaria- Bo DellaMaria

column1: Wildlife spotted so far this summer: Bald Eagle with one younger eagle- large and small snapping turtles with largest shell being over 12 inches in lenghth- various fish species- red bellied grass snake.
Lake level appears to be near 10 year high or more

column2: Clear- calm water.  Full ice out within 3 weeks (or less of reading).
Water was very clear in color.  Ice had been out for 2.0-2.5 weeks.
Water is relatively clear.  Appearance of some marl near surface.
Water is still relatively clear.  More marl or other debris in water.
Significant holiday boat traffic with skiing and tubing from 11am - 3pm.
Greater than normal boat traffic with skiing and tubing from 11am - 3pm.
Much less than normal boat traffic during wake operational periods from 11am - 3pm
Marl clumps present and floating in lake.  Very many schools of minnows.
Lesser clumps of Marl floating in open water.  Most of the marl is at the shoreline.
Heavy boat traffic on 7/3 - 7/4/15 for July 4th holiday.
Fair amount of boat traffic but less than that over the July 4th holiday.
No boat traffic on 7/17/15 (Day of the reading).  Minimal boat traffic Monday - Friday (7/13-7/17)
Presence of marl floating in water.  Very heavy boat traffic and use of the lake.  Lake depth has dropped approximately 12" since spring.
Clear day and calm.  Little sediment in lake.  Water was calm/glass like.  Lake level is approximately 12-16" lower than that of spring time.
Very much boat traffic over weekend when the readings were taken.
Can detect small pieces of marl in the water
Can detect small pieces of marl in the water
No boat traffic on the lake for 2-3 days
Labor Day weekend with very much boat traffic.  Very sunny day.
Virtually no lake traffic/boating during the day
No boat traffic during the day
A lot of weekend boat traffic.  Very overcast
Very much marl and pine pollen which made the lake appear less clear than normal
Very cloudy.  Storm imminent.  Poor lighting conditions.
Water was clear but obvious that sediment from powerboats had been kicked up and suspended in water.
Water clear.  Some sediment.  Less powerboat traffic during the week.
Lake stirred up by a lot of boat traffic and floating marl
Minimum boating traffic during the week preceding the seechi disk reading.
No wake speed restriction in place on lake due to high water levels.  Sediment suspended in water.  Unsure if the sediment is plant debris.
Lake under no wake restrictions due to high water level.  Sediment suspended in water which I am unsure if it is plant debris.
Lake is under no wake restrictions due to high water level.  The no wake speed restriction was imposed in 2019.
No wake speed limit restriction in place.  Small particulate suspended in water.
No wake speed restriction in place on lake.  Small particulate suspended in water.
Small amounts of marl floating in lake.  No wake speed limit remains in effect.
Small amounts of marl floating in lake.  No wake speed limit remains in effect.
Small amounts of marl floating in lake.  No wake speed limit remains in effect.
Small amounts of marl floating in lake.  No wake speed limit remains in effect.
Small amounts of marl floating in lake.  No wake speed limit remains in effect.
Slow- no wake speeds in force.  No significant marl particulate in water.  Overcast.
Slow- no wake speeds in force.  Small particulate (marl?) floating in water.  Partially overcast.
Wake speeds allowed.  Eurasian milfoil and marl particulate floating in water.
Wake speeds allowed.  Eurasian milfoil and marl particulate floating in water.
